dashboard.label: Source Type Manager
dashboard.description: Create and manage sourcetype configurations independent of getting data in.

html.p: Now introducing: the Source type manager! In Splunk 6.3 you can now view, edit, and create new source types.

Note: In order to access and use the Source type manager, you must have the capability “edit_sourcetypes” assigned to your login or role. This is capability is only assigned to the admin role by default.
Known issue: The “edit_sourcetypes” capability is not currently displaying in the capability list.

On the listing page, you can sort and filter source types by Name, Category, and App. To edit a sourcetype, click its name or the Edit action. To create a new sourcetype, click “New Source Type” (Note: you will not be able to supply a sample file for use with Data Preview)
html.h2: New source type & Editing a source type
html.p: The source types editor page allows you to define a new source type or make changes the index-time parameters of an existing source type. The Advanced section allows you to specify props.conf parameters and understand what the UI elements translate to. This functionality is very similar to what is available in Data Preview when adding data.

Note: You can only define or edit source types local to a specific app directory in $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/. Because the options available here are index-time specific, the primary use case for this feature is to define configurations that exist on Splunk Indexers. You also cannot define or editor source types within a deployment app directory – Source type manager is not currently integrated with deployment server.

Known Issue: Selecting an “Indexed Extractions” method should present additional options depending on the method – allowing you to define parameters like a line number containing a header, or manual field/header information.
